item.title: Smart Pointers in C++
item.description: Letâ€™s explore some examples of using std::unique_ptr, std::shared_ptr, and std::weak_ptr in C++. std::unique_ptr: std::unique_ptr is designed for exclusive ownership of a dynamically allocated object. It ensures that there can be at most one unique_ptr pointing to any resource. When the unique_ptr is destroyed, the resource it points to is automatically reclaimed. You cannot make a copy of a unique_ptr, but you can move it using the new move semantics. Example:
